children.text: There is visible evidence within the perimeter edge beam that it has not been properly vibrated during the pouring process, which has left missing areas within the set concrete.
Part 3.2.3.1 Concrete of the BCA requires that
‘Concrete must be placed, compacted and cured in accordance with good building practice’
, while the relevant Australian Standard AS 2870 Residential Slabs and Footings requires that
‘Concrete in beams shall be mechanically vibrated’ .

The builder should have the original design engineer inspect and make recommendations on how best to rectify these areas if they are deemed to require it, and seek their inspection notice and/or approval of this work. The owner should request a copy of the engineer’s comments and/or recommendations and ensure that any rectification work is carried out under the supervision and approval of the building surveyor.
